results.content:
This is the most in-depth Javascript course I have found on Udemy, and I have seen them all. Bogdan explains the theory in great detail and shows practical examples. 

The challenges are not only a practice of what you have learned so far but usually teach you something new and interesting.

The variable lifecycles section is a very unique lecture and it's really hard to find similar information anywhere. But it's a must to understand in my opinion.

One thing to note is that this is not a project-based course. This course coupled with a project-based course (that don't explain things in-depth), you can really master Javascript.

results.content: I'm a BEGINNER and so I was hoping the JavaScript Bible course would get me STARTED!   I'm up to lecture #11 and so far I have spent FOUR HOURS doing nothing but setting up the software and watching the instructor go through extremely confusing and difficult demonstrations about all the software.  We haven't even made it to Javascript yet!!  I've had several Udemy courses I've been following and I have never had such convoluted lectures. None of my other instructors needed like FIVE types of software with extremely convoluted instructions to talk about the topic.  I finally got to the FIRST actual Javascript lecture and it's NOT any better.  I'm sure this guy knows what he's talking about, but you don't teach quantum physics to kids in kindergarten!  You teach 1+1 and explain what that means FIRST!!!  I do not recommend this course.

response.content:
Hi Andralyn,

sorry that you found the beginning of the course difficult and long. 

In this course that is more than 40 hours long I teach not only JavaScript, but software development using JavaScript in general. And most developers use such development tools as Visual Studio Code, Git and Github. Setup that I show at the beginning saves you a lot of time in further lectures and modules.

Also I am always happy to help and I answer all questions in the QA section. 

Bogdan
